item.title: How to Install graphics.h C/C++ library on Ubuntu
item.description: In this post we are going to install graphics.h library on Ubuntu and to use it with gcc or g++ compiler. graphics.h provides access to a simple graphics library that makes it possible to draw lines, rectangles, ovals, arcs, polygons, images, and strings on a graphical window. If you want to install C/C++ graphic.h header file on Ubuntu you can visit this post. How to Install graphics.h C/C++ library on Ubuntu We have to also write int gd = DETECT, gm; initgraph(&gd, &gm, NULL); initgraph() initializes the graphics system by loading a graphics driver from disk (or validating a registered driver), and putting the system into graphics mode.
